Home.subtitle: Baptiste Poulain -- Fullstack/Frontend Developer
Home.title:
Creating <0> fluid and intuitive </0> 
 user experiences.
Showcase.w3d.title: <0>WeLoveDevs</0> - Web Developer
Showcase.w3d.description: For two years at WeLoveDevs, I immersed myself in development by exploring <0>UI/UX</0>. Passionate about carefully designed mockups and features, I gained expertise in <0>React</0> and <0>TypeScript</0> and of course <0>Tailwind CSS</0>. <1 /><1 /> These two years allowed me to deeply discover <0>Figma</0>, but also to try <0>Rive</0> for 2D animation. Firebase and Redux were widely used, and a transition to <0>Next JS</0> and <0>React Query</0> helped optimize the project as a whole. <1 /><1 /> I was able to contribute to the redesign of the homepage and other pages with less current design, thus perfecting my sense of design and technical skills.
Showcase.cozette.title: <0>Cozette</0> - Mobile Application
Showcase.cozette.description: Cozette is a cross-platform mobile application developed in <0>React Native</0> and <0>TypeScript</0>. It includes the <0>Expo</0> tool to facilitate development and deployment. <1 /><1 /> Its goal is to offer its users a <0>personalized experience</0> that fully meets their tastes, allowing them to mix restaurants with cultural places for their evening or weekend.
Showcase.willemse.title: <0>Willemse</0> - Web Developer
Showcase.willemse.description: Willemse France is a horticultural company based in Tourcoing, specializing in the sale of plants and garden products by mail order. <1 /><1 /> I worked on the <0>Groww</0> mobile application for which I created a Backoffice with <0>NodeJS</0> and <0>Express JS</0> to facilitate data exploration and manipulation. <0>Bootstrap</0> was used to create simple and effective interfaces.
Showcase.convertissol.title: <0>ConvertissOL</0> - Mobile Application
Showcase.convertissol.description: The ConvertissOL is an absurd project based on a fictitious unit of measurement, the <0>OL</0>. This application was developed in <0>Flutter</0> to ensure compatibility between Android and iOS. <1 /><1 /> We allowed users to authenticate using their <0>Google and/or Apple</0> accounts and save their data in the cloud via <0>Firebase</0>. The Twitter and SendMail APIs are also used, and <0>Google AdMob</0> was linked to experiment with monetization. <1 /><1 /> This application allowed a first approach to <0>Dart</0> and <0>Flutter</0>, and was an opportunity to discover mobile development.
